Class Hero

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hero
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Apprentice, Bulwark, Explorer, Gambler, Mercenary, Merchant

    public class Hero
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of Hero represent heroes on a team. Each Hero object represents one hero in the game. Instances of Hero should only be created via its children.

      Set to true if the hero has the special ability "25% damage reduction".

    • Field Detail

      • ALL_HEROES

        public static final Hero[] ALL_HEROES
        An array of instances of each Hero subclass.

      • DAMAGE_REDUCTION_MULTIPLIER

        public static final double DAMAGE_REDUCTION_MULTIPLIER
        The damage reduction multiplier applied when a hero with the damage reduction ability takes damage.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FASTER_HEALING_MULTIPLIER

        public static final double FASTER_HEALING_MULTIPLIER
        The multiplier applied to the application time of a healing item when it is applied to a hero with the faster healing special ability.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STORE_DISCOUNT_MULTIPLIER

        public static final double STORE_DISCOUNT_MULTIPLIER
        The multiplier to be applied to all items in the shop if the team has a hero with the store discount special ability.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        The name of the player assigned to this hero.

      • type

        private java.lang.String type
        A String representation of the hero's type, e.g. "Gambler". Each subclass of Hero has a different type.

      • specialAbility

        private java.lang.String specialAbility
        A String description of the hero's special ability, e.g. "Advantages in villain battles". Each subclass of Hero has a different special ability.

      • description

        private java.lang.String description
        A detailed String description of the hero's special ability and backstory, formatted so that it can be printed directly. Each subclass of Hero has a different description.

      • maxHealth

        private int maxHealth
        The maximum health the hero can have. Each subclass of Hero has a different maximum health, between 50 and 120.

      • currentHealth

        private int currentHealth
        The current health of the hero. Initialised to maxHealth when the hero is constructed. The value can range from 0 to maxHealth. If currentHealth reaches 0, the hero is dead and cannot recover.

      • hasStoreDiscount

        private boolean hasStoreDiscount
        Set to true if hero has the special ability "20% store discount".

      • hasBattleAdvantage

        private boolean hasBattleAdvantage
        Set to true if the hero has the special ability "Advantages in villain battles".

      • hasDoubleDamage

        private boolean hasDoubleDamage
        Set to true if the hero has the special ability "Double damage to villains".

      • hasMapAbility

        private boolean hasMapAbility
        Set to true if the hero has the special ability "Cities start with all sectors revealed".

      • hasReducedDamage

        private boolean hasReducedDamage
        Set to true if the hero has the special ability "25% damage reduction".

      • hasFasterHealing

        private boolean hasFasterHealing
        Set to true if hero has the special ability "Healing items apply twice as fast".

      • appliedPowerUps

        private java.util.ArrayList<PowerUp> appliedPowerUps
        A list of the power-ups which are currently applied to the hero, initialised empty. Each hero can have an unlimited number of power-ups of each type at any time.

      • appliedHealingItem

        private HealingItem appliedHealingItem
        The healing item currently applied to the hero. Set to null if there is no healing item applied. Each hero can have at most one healing item applied at any time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hero

        public Hero(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String type,
            java.lang.String specialAbility,
            java.lang.String description,
            int maxHealth)
        Constructor called from the constructors of each Hero subclass. Initialises the instance variables of the hero to the values defined in that subclass.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player assigned to the hero.
        type - The type of the Hero subclass.
        specialAbility - The special ability of the Hero subclass.
        description - The String description of the Hero subclass.
        maxHealth - The maximum health of the Hero subclass.

    • Method Detail

      • allHeroTypes

        public static java.lang.String[] allHeroTypes()
        Returns an array containing a String representation of the type of each Hero subclass. Used by the combo box which asks the user to select a hero type.
        Returns:
        A String array of the types of all Hero subclasses.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • powerUpTypeCounts

        public java.util.HashMap<PowerUpType,java.lang.Integer> powerUpTypeCounts()
        Creates a HashMap mapping each power up type to the number of that power up applied to the hero. If no power ups of a type are applied to the hero, then that type does not appear in the HashMap.
        Returns:
        A HashMap mapping each power up type to the number applied to the hero.

      • heal

        public void heal()
        If the hero has a currently applied healing item, updates the healing item, increasing the hero's current health if necessary. If the healing item has no increments left, the hero's applied healing item is set to null.

      • numPowerUps

        public int numPowerUps(PowerUpType powerUpType)
        Counts how many power-ups of the given type the hero currently has in its list of active power-ups.
        Parameters:
        powerUpType - The PowerUpType of interest.
        Returns:
        The number of power-ups of the given type posessed by the hero.

      • addPowerUp

        public void addPowerUp(PowerUp powerUp)
        Adds the given power-up to the hero's list of active power-ups
        Parameters:
        powerUp - The power-up to be added.
